intro: Bolivicactus otavianus, commonly known as the Otavian's cactus, is a rare and unique species native to the high-altitude regions of Bolivia. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and spiny, ribbed structure, which helps it conserve water in its arid environment. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the warmer months, adding a striking contrast to its green foliage. Its slow growth rate and specific habitat requirements make it a challenging species to cultivate outside its native range. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, Bolivicactus otavianus is considered endangered and is protected in its natural environment.
